intro: Nilgirianthus lupulinus, commonly known as the Nilgiri lupulin, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
